thobe.widgets.splitPanel

Class SplitPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • thobe.widgets.splitPanel.SplitPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SPSubFrameListener

    public class SplitPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements SPSubFrameListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    A class representing a panel that can consist of multiple sub-frames/- panels. The content of the sub-frames is dictated by the SPContentFactory that can be implemented as needed. The functionality of splitting(/ merging) a frame into sub-frames(/ to one frame) is implemented in the SplitPanel and can be used instantly.
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SplitPanel

        public SplitPanel(SPContentFactory contentFactory)
           throws SPTreeException
        Ctor
        Parameters:
        contentFactory - - An instance of a class implementing the SPContentFactory interface. This one has to be implemented if you want to use the SplitPanel. This factory offers three different methods that will be called by the SplitPanel internally. E.g. if a frame should be splitted into two subframes the SplitPanel calls the method SPContentFactory#createContentForKey(String) to create a new instance of the frame that should be splitted.
        Throws:
        SPTreeException

      • fromXMLStream

        public void fromXMLStream(java.io.Reader reader,
                 SPContentFactory factory)
                   throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException,
                          SPTreeException
        Load a SplitPanel from InputStream. Build up a hierarchy of SPFrame 's, that is a SplitPanel filled with contents described within the given stream.
        Parameters:
        reader - - a Reader providing access to the stream where the xml-structured information about the SplitPanel can be found.
        factory - - an instance of a class implementing the SPContentFactory interface. This class should be the same class that was used to create the SplitPanel hierarchy which should be loaded/ build up from the given stream. The currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be replaced by the given SPContentFactory. This parameter can be null. In this case the currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be used (and won't be replaced).
        Throws:
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        SPTreeException

      • fromXMLStream

        public void fromXMLStream(java.io.Reader reader)
                   throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException,
                          SPTreeException
        Load a SplitPanel from InputStream. Build up a hierarchy of SPFrame 's, that is a SplitPanel filled with contents described within the given stream.
        Parameters:
        reader - - a Reader providing access to the stream where the xml-structured information about the SplitPanel can be found.
        factory - - an instance of a class implementing the SPContentFactory interface. This class should be the same class that was used to create the SplitPanel hierarchy which should be loaded/ build up from the given stream. The currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be replaced by the given SPContentFactory. This parameter can be null. In this case the currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be used (and won't be replaced).
        Throws:
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        SPTreeException

      • fromXMLStream

        public void fromXMLStream(java.io.InputStream iStream,
                 SPContentFactory factory)
                   throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException,
                          SPTreeException
        Load a SplitPanel from InputStream. Build up a hierarchy of SPFrame 's, that is a SplitPanel filled with contents described within the given stream.
        Parameters:
        iStream - - the stream where the xml-structured information about the SplitPanel can be found.
        factory - - an instance of a class implementing the SPContentFactory interface. This class should be the same class that was used to create the SplitPanel hierarchy which should be loaded/ build up from the given stream. The currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be replaced by the given SPContentFactory. This parameter can be null. In this case the currently active SPContentFactory of this instance of SplitPanel will be used (and won't be replaced).
        Throws:
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        SPTreeException

      • asXMLToStream

        public void asXMLToStream(java.io.OutputStream stream)
                   throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Streams the settings of this SplitPanel using a xml-structure.
        example (stream to stdout):
        SplitPanel sp = ...;
        sp.asXMLToStream(System.out);
